intro: Elatostema pingbianense, commonly known as the Pingbian Elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan province, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
